unittitle_ssm: Marion Eugenie Bauer Papers
abstract_ssm: Marion Eugenie Bauer (1887-1955) was a composer and teacher, born in Walla Walla, Washington, who became the first woman faculty member of the Music Department at New York University (NYU). The papers consist of unpublished manuscripts of Bauer's proposed books, articles, and speeches. Some published material and biographical information is included.
corpname_ssm: New York University. Department of Music
heading_ssm: Marion Eugenie Bauer Papers

unittitle_ssm: Biographical Information: Who's Who in America, 1956-1957 "In Memory of Marion Bauer," by Frederic Stoessel, n.d. Keynotes, April 1951 re: Town Hall concert honoring Marion Bauer and presenting her works, May 8, 1951.
